summary:
Here is a summary of the document in 3-5 sentences, focusing on the main topic and key concepts:

In the Call of Cthulhu role-playing game, the "Transferable Benefit" rule allows for the improvement of one specialization to have a positive impact on other closely related specialisms. When a character raises a specialization to 50% or over, all other related skill specializations are raised by 10 percentage points, but not higher than 50%. This rule can be applied multiple times, with the second application raising related specializations by 10 percentage points again, but not higher than 90%. This rule applies to various skills, including Fighting, Firearms, Languages, and Survival.

qa_pairs.question: What happens when a character raises a specialization to 50% or over?
qa_pairs.answer: All other related skill specializations are raised by 10 percentage points (but not higher than 50%).

qa_pairs.question: Can a character raise a specialization to 90% or over and get additional 10 points in other specializations?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, this can happen only once more: when a character first raises a specialization to 90% or over, all other related specializations are again raised by 10 percentage points (but not higher than 90%).

qa_pairs.question: How many percentage points do all other related skill specializations gain when a character raises a specialization to 50% or over?
Can a character boost a specialization and gain additional 10 points in other specializations before spending more points in those other specializations?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, during investigator creation the player may boost a specialization and gain the additional 10 points in each of the others.

qa_pairs.question: What happens to other related skill specializations when a character raises a specialization to 50% or over?
qa_pairs.answer: They are raised by 10 percentage points (but not higher than 50%).

qa_pairs.question: What is the result when a character raises a specialization to 90% or over, in addition to the previous effect?
qa_pairs.answer: All other related specializations are again raised by 10 percentage points (but not higher than 90%).
